content.question: Conducting spheres 1 and 2 are on insulated stands and are placed close to each other, as shown in the figure. The spheres are initially uncharged, and sphere 1 is connected to ground. A rod carrying positive charge is brought near the right side of sphere 2. The ground is disconnected and then the rod is removed. Which of the following represents the resulting charge distribution on the two spheres?

choices.label: The figure presents two conducting spheres, labeled from left to right, 1 and 2, that are on insulating spheres and placed close to one another. Sphere 1 has negative charges spread across its right side. Sphere 2 has positive charges spread across its left side and negative charges spread across its right side.

The figure presents two conducting spheres, labeled from left to right, 1 and 2, that are on insulating spheres and placed close to one another. Sphere 1 is positively charged and sphere 2 is negatively charged.

The figure presents two conducting spheres, labeled from left to right, 1 and 2, that are on insulating spheres and placed close to one another. Sphere 1 is negatively charged and sphere 2 is uncharged.
The figure presents two conducting spheres, labeled from left to right, 1 and 2, that are on insulating spheres and placed close to one another. Both spheres are uncharged.

content.answer: The figure presents two conducting spheres, labeled from left to right, 1 and 2, that are on insulating spheres and placed close to one another. Sphere 1 has negative charges spread across its right side. Sphere 2 has positive charges spread across its left side and negative charges spread across its right side.
